Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Reverend Dr. Charles Oliver Galbreath, Senior Pastor, Clarendon Road Church located at 3304 Clarendon Road, Brooklyn, NY 11203.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Louis.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Dr. Charles Oliver Galbreath, Senior Pastor Clarendon Road Church located at 3304 Clarendon Road, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11203.

Council Member Louis moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 8, 2023 and June 22, 2023 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gutiérrez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gutierrez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 8, 2023 and June 22, 2023 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Bottcher
Pursuant to Sections 11.20b and 11.20c of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application C 230238 ZSM (Madison Square Garden Special Permit) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Madison Square Garden Special Permit, Manhattan (C 230238 ZSM)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the department of social services from requiring an applicant for a rental assistance voucher to have resided or reside in a shelter of any type, and to repeal sections 21-145.1 and 21-145.2 of such code in relation thereto
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the department of social services from requiring an applicant for a rental assistance voucher to have resided or reside in a shelter of any type.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Report by the department of health and mental hygiene on drowning deaths that occur in the city.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Allowing consolidation of required reports on building energy efficiency and emissions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Health and New York State Environmental Facilities Corporation to fairly allocate grants and loans for lead service line replacement approved in the Federal Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and to remove all rules preventing New York City from receiving a fair share of this funding.

Items.MatterName: NYS Department of Health and NYS Environmental Facilities Corporation to fairly allocate grants and loans for lead service line replacement approved in the Federal Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and to remove all rules preventing NYC from receiving a fair

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: NYC Water Board to notify all council members and community boards at least 30 days before a public hearing concerning an annual water rate adjustment.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Carrying out testing for and reporting on the presence of controlled substances with significant potential for addiction or other serious health consequences in wastewater.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 1656 West 10th Street Rezoning, Brooklyn (N 220286 ZRK)

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.
The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, August 3, 2023.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application number C 210314 ZMK (1160 Flushing Avenue) submitted by 1160 Flushing Avenue, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 13b, changing from an M1-1 District to an M1-5 District, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 4, Council District 34.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 1160 Flushing Avenue, Brooklyn (C 210314 ZMK)

Items.Title: Application number N 230068 ZRR (56 William Avenue) submitted by the Estate of Clement Marotte, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York modifying Appendix A of Article X, Chapter 7, concerning the boundaries of Designated Open Space, within the Special South Richmond Development District in the Borough of Staten Island, Community District 3, Council District 51.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 56 William Avenue, Staten Island (N 230068 ZRR)

Items.Title: Application number N 230240 ZRM (Arena Text Amendment) submitted by the Department of City Planning, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying Article VII, Chapter 4 (Special Permits by the City Planning Commission), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 5, Council District 3.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Arena Text Amendment, Manhattan (N 230240 ZRM)

Items.Title: Application number C 230238 ZSM (Madison Square Garden Special Permit) submitted by MSG Arena, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-41* of the Zoning Resolution to allow an arena with a maximum capacity of 22,000 seats within an existing 10-story building on property located at 4 Penn Plaza (Block 781, Lots 1, 2 and 10), in C6-4 and C6-6 Districts, partially within the Special Hudson Yards District (Pennsylvania Station Subarea B4) and partially within the Special Midtown District, Borough of Manhattan, Community District 5, Council District 3.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Madison Square Garden Special Permit, Manhattan (C 230238 ZSM)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 193-A,  VOTE: 42-7-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).
Present but Not Voting: CM Moya.

L.U. No. 237 & Res. No. 721, VOTE: 48-1-0
Negative: CM Barron.
Present but Not Voting: CM Moya.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 9.60 of the Council Rules, the Speaker (Council Member Adams) separated the override bills Int. Nos. 229-A, 878-A, 893-A, and 894-A from the remaining General Orders for consideration and a vote prior to the commencement of the vote on the General Orders Calendar.

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question "Shall the bills pass, the objection of the Mayor notwithstanding?".  The following bills were decided in the affirmative by at  least two-thirds of the Council required for passage:

Int. No. 229-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 42-8-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Int. No. 878-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 42-8-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Int. No. 893-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE 42-8-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Int. No. 894-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 42-8-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).
